question:
The constitution of India confers fundamental rights subject to some conditions to every religious denomination to:
  1. To establish and maintain institutions for religious purpose
  2. To own and acquire movable and immovable property
  3. To propagate its religion
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Article 26 confers upon the religious groups the freedom to manage religious affairs. It reads as- \"Subject to public order, morality and health, every religious denomination or any section thereof shall have the right-

1. to establish and maintain institutions for religious and charitable purposes;

2. to manage its own affairs in matters of religion;

3. to own and acquire movable and immovable property; and

4. to administer such property in accordance with law.
